reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Libya: Supporting Dialogue Platforms in Libya

description.narrative: Since the fall of the Gaddafi regime, Libya has become a “stateless state”. Libya’s political actors have failed to establish a new inclusive political order, including to form a unified state controlled army. Instead, Libya is witnessing a severe fr agmentation of power and political polarization, coupled with a proliferation of armed groups. Political divides are shaped by regional, ideological, economic and societal cleavages. Elites that prospered under the Gaddafi regime and new post-revolutionary elites contest political power and resources. The project provides actors from across the political spectrum an opportunity to engage in informal dialogue on critical yet highly contested transition issues and develop joint solutions to them. The inclusiv e platforms for dialogue are particularly important if some of the key groups reject participation in or are side-lined from formal transition processes. The absence of spaces for encounter and communication often serve to deepen mistrust and misperception s. In reverse, sustained, inclusive dialogue can help to enhance trust and help to overcome the persisting divisions between the political/social groups. Through their engagement in an informal setting, the participants demonstrate that, despite deep divis ions, dialogue among all key actors is possible and can bring significant benefits to the political process. Through national and local level informal dialogues, the project enables stakeholders to develop consensual policy recommendations related to key t ransitional issues in Libya. The underlying assumption is that for the political transition to proceed peacefully, the post-Jamahiriya Libya needs inclusive dialogue platforms engaging relevant stakeholders in Libya’s key geographical areas. Given the fr agmentation of power centres, Libya’s new social contract will be formed through an incremental process of stabilization at the regional level through power consolidation and mutual understanding at the local level, leading into a formula for a national level unified governance mechanism.
